lexUnit.name: chatter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: talk rapidly or incessantly about trivial matters

sentence.text: I have n't all morning to listen to you chatter . "
Socrates , on the other hand , chatters about ` hydroelectric spheres " and such like .
` They sometimes have jazz here in the evenings , " Agnes chattered , ` although I do n't know if it 's up to your standards .
` The inspector believes the burglar is here in Cannes , " chattered Natalia .
They go on chattering statistics .
Bernard said , ` Ellen , the sooner your friends stop coming round and chattering the happier I will be . "

Sabine had half expected to be taken round to some tradesman 's entrance , but Marie-Christine led the way to the main door , chattering nineteen to the dozen , clearly relieved that her mission was almost accomplished .
We chattered a while and Benjamin was on the point of leaving when the Queen stepped forward .
He chattered about bills of sale , the purchase of canvas and parchment , the cost of carters and the money needed for ship and crew .
Benjamin appeared to be in better humour and chattered about the history of the chateau as we broke our fast in the great hall .
We chattered about Ipswich and I found the business of Scawsby 's treatment of my mother still rankled in my heart .
At first she was shy but then she chattered about Nantes , how she missed the dark woods and green fields of Brittany .
My dearest love , I chatter about all sorts of odd news , when I really only want to tell you that my real self is in your keeping .
Emmeline was chattering to Alfred who had somehow managed to join them , since Rachel had unwisely attached herself to Lady Westbourne , and was now sorely regretting this good nature .
Madeleine chattered to her brother-in-law .
Elaine was chattering to the chap with the soulful face as if she 'd never forgotten how to talk .
Ludens and Irina jostled each other , shouted at each other , chattered to each other , argued a lot , laughed a lot .
As he ate and drank she found herself chattering away to him out of nervousness , a stream of things that went through her head , the small happenings of a day .
` Ca n't stay and chatter to the unemployed , " said Lawrence , picking up his briefcase .
Wives in good thick skirts chattered between auctions .
Kirsty chattered excitedly throughout the journey , helping to keep Shiona 's mind off her anxieties .
But the cook was in fine form and they seemed to be thawing a bit when I left them chattering away in Greek with Denholm sitting among them and not understanding a word they were saying .
` She carried on chattering away happily for a while before she realized that Uncle Albert was n't saying much .
I mean , here am I , chattering away to you about the outcome of the war and you actually know , Cassie .
The girls began to chatter away .
He chattered on in his easy way to a somewhat sceptical family who were not accustomed to thinking of Bodo in this new and totally unexpected light .
She chattered on , unaware that in the next bed Victoria silently registered her curiosity about a member of the Royal Family as a threat .
Noticing the stiffness , Muriella chattered on to cover it .
His wife chattered on to the party at the other end of the line .
I 'm apt to chatter on about nothing , and I must say it was nice to have someone to talk to , like I said . "
` Well , she might have been angry with him , " Adele chattered on , ` but he 's not the sort of man one can ignore , is he ?
` My lord 's sister seems a sweet lady , " Ellen chattered on , pouring the warm milk into a goblet .
A woman chatters excitedly and points to the rubble that carpets the floor .
Enchanted , she too watched the sweet-faced boy who was chattering excitedly while his fond father plied him with Carnival cakes .
She chattered happily as Patrick drove along the Marylebone Road , speculating on the miracle that had brought John and Angela back from the dead .
During the first part of the journey , he had chattered incessantly , excited by all that he saw , his spirits elated .
She was chattering nervously , but now at least with relief .
While Lynn and Thomas and Vicky and Dennis chattered , I sat back and let my fingers do the talking .
There was Jim Caswell , of course , but Jim would n't chatter
